intro: Machaeranthera scabrella, commonly known as the scabrous blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
